Key Match Events: Jaren Jackson Jr. had 20 points and seven rebounds, leading the Memphis Grizzlies to a 134-89 victory over the Portland Trail Blazers.
Jake LaRavia added 18 points off the bench for the Grizzlies.
Jerami Grant scored 20 points for Portland.
Memphis led by as many as 45 points during the game.
The Grizzlies jumped out to a 31-17 lead after the first quarter and led by as many as 25 in the first half.
In the opening quarter, Zach Edey boxed out Donovan Clingan and popped out the rebound to Scotty Pippen Jr., who made the 3-pointer to put the Grizzlies up 29-11.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Memphis was missing key players Ja Morant, Marcus Smart, and Desmond Bane due to injuries.
It was the first meeting between Memphis' rookie Zach Edey and Portland’s Donovan Clingan since the 2024 NCAA championship game.
Memphis' 5-foot-8 rookie Yuki Kawamura came into the game in the fourth quarter to applause from the Blazers fans.
The Blazers held a moment of silence before the game for former broadcaster Brian Wheeler, who passed away on Friday at age 62.
Others: The Blazers shot just 17 of 49 from the floor in the first half and finished 4 of 42 from 3-point range.
The Grizzlies visit the Los Angeles Lakers on Wednesday.
The Trail Blazers host the Minnesota Timberwolves on Tuesday.
